[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 20]
Reasoning: **Analyzing the Big Blind: To Play or to Skip?**

Okay, so here's the situation. I'm at Ante 2/8, Round 2, facing the Big Blind. My immediate concern is reaching the 1200 chip target, and then the Boss blind at 1600. I have a few Jokers to work with: Mail-In Rebate, Ride the Bus, Red Card, and Blue Joker. Right now, Blue Joker is the star, giving a massive 104 chips boost. Mail-In Rebate offers a significant multiplier (+10), and the base Three of a Kind hand level 2 provides a reasonable chip and multiplier boost. "Ride the Bus" is currently at zero, but could scale up if I play hands without face cards. Red Card is useless without money to buy and skip booster packs.

If I play this round, I can easily beat the chip requirement with my current setup. A single Three of a Kind with the Jokers easily scores well over 2500, and I'd get around $4-8. However, if I skip, I get the Coupon Tag, which makes the *initial* shop cards and booster packs *free*.

Initially, I had a mental tug-of-war. I was weighing the immediate cash gain from playing against the long-term value of the Coupon Tag. I considered the scaling potential of "Ride the Bus" and the necessity of money for "Red Card." But then I remembered I can crush the Boss blind (1600) with my current Jokers and Three of a Kind hand with zero discards.

The crucial turning point was realizing I only have $0. Earning ~$5 to enter the shop doesn't compare to a free Mega Pack or a Joker. This Coupon Tag is extremely powerful when broke because it opens up the possibility of getting a high-value Joker or pack for free, something I can't afford with a few dollars.

I also need to check the Mail-In Rebate's rank. If I play this Big Blind, I might be able to get $5 (by discarding), but this is hard to do in the Boss round (0 discards). The prompt doesn't give this level. I will likely need a round of playing to scale "Ride the Bus" and getting some money.

Ultimately, given my current financial state and the power of the free shop, skipping the round for the Coupon Tag is the best play here. It's the most economically sound move, allowing me to significantly upgrade my deck and/or Jokers. The $4-8 from playing the round is not as valuable as a free Mega Pack at this point, especially since I'm confident I can beat the Boss.

Reasoning: **Analyzing the Boss Blind: Ready to Play**

Okay, so I'm at Ante 2, Round 2, the "Blind Select" phase. My goal is to beat the boss with the "0 discards" condition. This immediately makes "Mail-In Rebate" useless this round, so that's something to keep in mind. I need to score 1600 chips to win.

I have these Jokers in play: "Mail-In Rebate" (Holo), "Ride the Bus", "Red Card", and "Blue Joker".  My current hand level is "Three of a Kind" at level 2, which gives me 50 chips and 5 mult as the base. The "Coupon Tag" is active, which means the next shop will have free cards/packs, a nice bonus after beating this blind.

Based on my Jokers, I estimate that a hand will get me around 2310 chips (50 from base hand + 104 from Blue Joker times 15 mult from Mail-In Rebate and the hand). This is well above the 1600 needed. The order of these Jokers doesn't really matter since all modifiers are additive.

My available actions are limited to `play_round`, `use_consumable`, `sell_consumable`, `rearrange_jokers`, and `sell_joker`.  No consumables to use or sell, and no reason to sell any Jokers. The current phase is the blind select; no card selections have occurred yet.  So, the only logical action is `play_round`.  The schema requires an action, `positions` (which is `null` here), `intended_hand_type` (which I could include but I don't need to specify at the BLIND_SELECT screen), and estimated chips (I can include these as well).

I don't need to rearrange jokers at this stage. It's a simple `play_round` command to enter the blind. I'm choosing to enter with the intent of playing three-of-a-kind.

Final decision: `play_round`.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
